Prerequisites: C OR HIGHER IN ACG 2021 OR ACG 2022
Course Description: A STUDY OF THE ACCUMULATION, INTERPRETATION AND CONTROL OF COSTS USING BOTH JOB ORDER AND PROCESS COSTING SYSTEMS.  IN ADDITION, BUDGETING, COST-VOLUME PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS, AND DECISION MAKING IN A MANAGERIAL SETTING ARE CONSIDERED.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENT SHOULD:
1. DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF TECHNICAL ACCOUNTING VOCABULARY, THE LANGUAGE OF BUSINESS.
2. DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANING OF COST-VOLUME-PROFIT CONCEPTS & APPLY THOSE CONCEPTS TO CORRECTLY ANALYZE & SOLVE RELATED BUSINESS PROBLEMS.
3. DEMONSTRATE UNDERSTANDING OF TIME VALUE OF MONEY CONCEPTS & CORRECTLY APPLY THOSE CONCEPTS TO SOLVE A VARIETY OF BUSINESS PROBLEMS.
4. CONSTRUCT BUDGET SCHEDULES, COMPUTE VARIANCES FROM BUDGETED RRESULTS, & ANALYZE THOSE VARIANCES.
Textbook(s):
1. MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING 12 ED BY GARRISON, NOREEN & BREWER.
2. FOUR FUNCTION HAND HELD CALCULATOR FOR DAILY USE
3. STRAIGHT EDGE OR RULER.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
